= Word wrap in blocks

== Sidebar with long text

****
This is a sidebar paragraph that contains enough text to exceed a typical terminal width so that word wrapping is exercised properly inside the box-drawn borders.
****

== Example with long text

====
This example block has a paragraph with quite a lot of words that should definitely be wrapped when rendered inside the terminal box drawing characters to avoid breaking the visual layout.
====

== Admonition with long text

NOTE: This is a note admonition with a paragraph that contains enough words to require wrapping when displayed inside the bordered admonition block in the terminal converter output.

== Quote with long text

[quote]
____
This is a quote block paragraph that is intentionally long enough to require word wrapping so that the left border character is not disrupted by the terminal wrapping the raw text.
____

== Listing should not wrap

[source,rust]
----
fn this_is_a_very_long_function_name_that_should_not_be_wrapped_because_listing_blocks_are_preformatted() -> bool { true }
----
